result.execSummary:
The defendant Jose L C RomeroTorres was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid in 60 days, or alternate of 7 days jail as penalty for non-payment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jose L C RomeroTorres

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Jose L C RomeroTorres in court with attorney Roberto R. Ledesma.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State moves to amend count 1 to County Ord. D.C. 13-102(c)(8) and dismiss and read-in count 2. Defendant enters a no contest plea. Court imposed a fine of $330.50 or alternate of 7 days jail. 60 days to fine.

Defendant Jose L C RomeroTorres in court with attorney Roberto R. Ledesma.  Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel is requesting adjournment to have more time to speak with the state as the defendant has another OAWI pending in Municipal Court. State has no objections. Court grants the request.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jose L C RomeroTorres in court with attorney Roberto R. Ledesma.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Ledesma advised court that they have received an offer from the State, but would like time to speak with the State for further negotiations. Court grants.  Hearing scheduled for October 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jose L C RomeroTorres in court with attorney  Jacques Amann for Roberto R. Ledesma.  Timothy F. Westphal appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel requests adjournment. State has no objections. Court grants.  Hearing scheduled for September 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.

Defendant Jose L C RomeroTorres in court, in custody, with attorney Kelsey Morin.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney appears as friend of the court.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for July 13, 2015 at 09:00 am.
